benchmark_details.name: CausalNet
benchmark_details.overview: CausalNet is a novel dataset specifically curated to benchmark and enhance the causal reasoning capabilities of LLMs. This dataset presents a diverse set of causal and counterfactual questions, allowing researchers to explore the intricacies of cause-and-effect relationships in various contexts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the causal reasoning capabilities of large language models through a comprehensive dataset that provides causal and counterfactual analysis research.

data.source: CausalNet dataset developed through a multi-step process involving GPT-4, filtered and refined by authors for quality.
data.annotation: Curated by authors and filtered for logical consistency and real-world relevance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on performance across multiple causal reasoning tasks and datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in distinguishing causal relationships in scenarios.
methodology.validation: Performance was evaluated by comparing CARE-CA's results to existing benchmarks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Efforts were made to mitigate the inclusion of sensitive or discriminatory content in the CausalNet dataset.
